html:
Nov 16 (Reuters) - The following are the top stories in the Wall Street Journal. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.


- Ohio's attorney general is suing Meta Platforms Inc., formerly known as Facebook Inc. FB.O, alleging the company misled the public about how it controlled its algorithm and the effects its products have on children. https://on.wsj.com/30p1jS0


- California said it has secured an agreement with Amazon.com Inc AMZN.O to rectify how the company handled Covid-19 notifications to warehouse workers and local health agencies. https://on.wsj.com/3nhkDd0


- President Biden and Chinese President Xi Jinping used a virtual meeting Monday evening to cool tensions between the two powers as the leaders seek to manage issues they disagree on and identify ways to communicate to avert conflict. https://on.wsj.com/3kGeK7c


- Elon Musk's wave of Tesla Inc. TSLA.O share sales continued into a second week, with the car maker's chief executive on Monday unloading more than 934,000 shares valued at around $930 million, while also exercising stock options, according to new disclosures. https://on.wsj.com/3FnTzPA


(Compiled by Bengaluru newsroom)

(( globalnewsmonitoring@thomsonreuters.com ))
